alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central St. Johns and northeastern Putnam Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Federal Point, or 8 miles north of Hastings, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hastings, Federal Point, Spuds, Elkton and Bakersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns
